meanings.sent1: I squooshed the ball in my hand.
meanings.sent2: She likes to squoosh the playdough to make shapes.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to squoosh through the narrow gap in the door.
meanings.sent4: The wrestler managed to squoosh his opponent to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to squoosh the garlic to release its flavor.

meanings.definition: A soft, wet sound made by pressing or squeezing something
meanings.sent1: The squoosh of the mud under my boots was satisfying.
meanings.sent2: I heard a squoosh as I stepped on the overripe tomato.
meanings.sent3: The squoosh of the sponge filled the kitchen as I washed the dishes.
meanings.sent4: The squoosh of the wet sponge reminded me of rainy days.
meanings.sent5: The squoosh of the toothpaste tube signaled it was almost empty.

meanings.definition: A small, tight space or area
meanings.sent1: The mouse disappeared into the squoosh behind the cabinet.
meanings.sent2: She found a cozy squoosh between the pillows on the couch.
meanings.sent3: The child giggled as he hid in the squoosh under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel squeezed into the squoosh between the branches.
meanings.sent5: The bookshelf had a hidden squoosh where she kept her treasures.
